description:
Fixed duplicate event notification for preference changes on a webui.

BUG=89712
TEST=Preferences should still work as expected.


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=93364

messages.text:
LGTM w/ a nit:

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc
File chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc#newcode387
chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc:387: pref_callback_map_.upper_bound(*pref_name);
Nit: you could use |pref_callback_map_.equal_range(*pref_name)| to get both iterators at the same time, and then make the for loop a bit more symmetric:

  for (it = range.first; it != range.second; ++it)

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1002/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc
File chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1002/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc#newcode389
chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc:389: PreferenceCallbackMap::const_iterator iter;
|iter| should be inside the loop scope.

@jhawkins: please have another look, thanks.

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1002/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc
File chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/7429004/diff/1002/chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc#newcode389
chrome/browser/ui/webui/options/core_options_handler.cc:389: PreferenceCallbackMap::const_iterator iter;
On 2011/07/19 18:06:22, James Hawkins wrote:
> |iter| should be inside the loop scope.

Done.

subject: Fixed duplicate event notification for preference changes on a webui.
